intro: Cunuria casiquiarensis, commonly known as the Casiquiare River cunuria, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, low-light conditions typical of the understory of tropical forests. Cunuria casiquiarensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
